subject: Programming
title: Virtual Machines and Containers
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Virtual Machines and Containers.

hook.text: Running untrusted code on your real machine is risky. What if it had its own fake machine?

buildup.text: Virtual machines simulate an entire computer inside your computer, complete with its own OS.

discovery.text: Containers are lighter. They share the host OS kernel but isolate the application environment.

twist.text: Docker made containers mainstream. Now apps ship with their entire environment included.

climax.text: Cloud computing runs on VMs and containers. Your Netflix stream runs inside one right now.

punchline.text: Computers inside computers power the cloud.

quiz.question: How do containers differ from virtual machines?
options: They share the host OS kernel
They include their own full OS
